meanings.definition: To establish or organize according to the principles of feudalism.
meanings.sent1: The king was feudalizing the land, dividing it among his loyal knights.
meanings.sent2: The feudal lord was feudalizing his territory, creating a system of vassals and serfs.
meanings.sent3: The farmer joked that he was feudalizing his backyard by making his chickens pay rent.
meanings.sent4: The idea of feudalizing the company structure seemed outdated in the modern world.
meanings.sent5: She imagined feudalizing the school cafeteria, with students owing allegiance to different lunch tables.

meanings.definition: To bring under feudal control or influence.
meanings.sent1: The warlord was feudalizing the neighboring villages, imposing his rule on them.
meanings.sent2: The conqueror was feudalizing the conquered lands, establishing a new hierarchy.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be feudalizing the household, demanding tribute in the form of treats.
meanings.sent4: The politician was accused of feudalizing the government, favoring only his supporters.
meanings.sent5: The idea of feudalizing the playground led to a playful game of knights and peasants among the children.
